definition: to pull/to tear/(of cloth, thread etc) to buy/to chat/to gossip/(coll.) (Tw) ridiculous/hokey
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to drag/to pull/to raise a child (through difficulties)/to help/to support/to drag in/to chat
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
to make even/to balance/(fig.) to be even/to call it quits
to tug at/to pull at sb aggressively/to take sb's hand or arm in a too familiar way/(derog.) to hobnob/to consort
to tug at/to pull at sb aggressively/to take sb's hand or arm in a too familiar way/(derog.) to hobnob/to consort

sentences.english: Czeslaw tore the cigarette out of Piotr’s mouth.
sentences.chinese: 切斯沃夫從彼得亞雷的嘴上一把扯下香菸。

sentences.english: I think the man tried to make some kind of connection with Schopenhauer.
sentences.chinese: 我想這個男的試着想要扯上叔本華。

sentences.english: The neon which symbolizes material (or "materialism") has all of a sudden been deprived of its target.
sentences.chinese: 象徵物慾的霓虹突然被扯脫了其所施欲的對象。

sentences.english: With a malicious crackle the old man held up a small white swaddling garment.
sentences.chinese: 老頭啪一聲狠狠扯下毯子上的一個白色的小裝飾。

sentences.english: Lobsters are able to reproduce claws when they are torn off.
sentences.chinese: 龍蝦的螯被扯去後還能再生出來。

sentences.english: Don't digress from the subject when lecturing.
sentences.chinese: 講課時不要扯到枝節上。

sentences.english: This frightened me so much I ran out of the room and half way across the house yelling my lungs out.
sentences.chinese: 當時我非常害怕，扯着嗓子喊着從那個房間跑了出去。

sentences.english: The bark was riven off from the trunk.
sentences.chinese: 樹皮從樹幹上被扯了下來。

sentences.english: He pulled my sleeve, attracted my attention in this way.
sentences.chinese: 他扯了扯我的衣袖以引起我的注意。

sentences.english: He pulled my sleeve, attracted my attention in this way.
sentences.chinese: 他扯了扯我的衣袖以引起我的注意。

sentences.english: He doesn't come near to touching the main point, but shies away into side issues.
sentences.chinese: 他不去觸及要點，卻扯到枝節問題上去了。

sentences.english: She ripped down the old window curtains this morning.
sentences.chinese: 她今天上午把舊窗簾扯了下來。

sentences.english: He rived a branch away from the tree.
sentences.chinese: 他從這棵樹上扯下一根樹枝。

sentences.english: I blasted the volume, opened the windows, and sang as loud as I could.
sentences.chinese: 我開大音量，開了窗，扯着嗓子大聲唱起來。

sentences.english: Tearing off mask could only uncover true face. But sometimes true face unnecessarily reflects true heart.
sentences.chinese: 扯下面具只能露出真容，真容有時未必代表真心。

sentences.english: Hitched to lines made of bamboo, straining with bent backs, their fingers almost touched the ground.
sentences.chinese: 縴夫扯着竹繩彎腰使勁，手指幾乎觸地。

definition: to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
to peel/to skin/to tear/to pull down/to cling to (sth on which one is climbing)/to dig
to rake up/to steal/to braise/to crawl
to seize/to clutch/to grab firmly and pull
to rub against/to walk slowly/(coll.) to freeload
to diverge/to branch off the road/to change (the subject)
to throw/to fling/to swing/to leave behind/to throw off/to dump (sb)
to stab/to poke/to prod/to nudge/to disclose
to push lightly/to flick to one side/to get rid of
